alert.note: Alert for Pike (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 10:49AM CDT until June 06 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Mississippi River at Chester. Mississippi River at Clarksville. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Clarksville. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.3 feet, The road to Port Marmac, a riverside community of about 15 homes just south of Clarksville, begins flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Saturday was 25.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 22.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Mississippi River Clarksville 25.0 25.1 24.7 24.2 23.8 23.4 23.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
